revised_title: Nonlinear Interaction of Tollmien-Schlichting Waves and Taylor-Görtler Vortices in Curved Channel Flows
tldr: The authors study the nonlinear interaction of Tollmien-Schlichting waves and Taylor-Görtler vortices in fully developed flows in curved channels. They investigate the interaction between lower-branch Tollmien-Schlichting waves and small-wavenumber Taylor-Görtler vortices, which is important for understanding the transition process in external flows. The authors find that the interaction can lead to a finite-time singularity in the solution and a more complicated type of evolution equation, depending on the orientation of the wavefronts of the Tollmien-Schlichting waves to the Görtler vortex.
